a.title: Help with Learning at Home
Meal Distribution Information
Senator Learning Kits
Latest News
Free / Reduced Cost Internet Access
Frequently Asked Questions
Help with Learning at Home
Help with Connecting at Home
Employee Resources

div.h4: Moving to a "new normal" of working and learning from home presents unique challenges for families and educators to facilitate online learning. Below are some resources you can use as we navigate this together as one Senator family.
How do I contact my student's teacher?
div.p: Capital School District maintains an online directory of all staff members to help you stay connected that is searchable by name. You can find that directory here.

div.h4: How do I contact my student's Administrator?
div.p: Capital School District maintains an online directory of all District and Building Administrators for your reference. Please see the links below:

a.title: School Leadership
School Leadership
District Leadership

div.h4: How do I get technical support while at home?
div.p: Capital School District has compiled a list of helpful resources for working with the connectivity of devices at home. Please see our "Help with Connecting at Home" page to utilize those resources.

p.strong: Please email help@capital.k12.de.us for help with any questions not addressed on that page. We will do our best to connect you with the right resources.

div.h4: What is Clever and what does it do for my student?
div.p: Clever is an online learning portal designed to help your students get signed into educational resources that are normally used in the classroom. With many online applications being "Clever enabled" this provides a single login interface for many instructional programs and a collection of links for other programs that are not yet enabled for Clever. You can visit the Capital School District Clever Portal by visiting http://www.capital.k12.de.us/student_portal or https://clever.com/in/capitalschooldistrict.

p.img:
Step 1: Select "Login with Active Directory"
Step 2: Enter your student's username and password (studentusername@capital.k12.de.us). This is the same username your student uses to login to Capital School District computers while in the classroom. Passwords for grade 5 and above is the student's ID. Passwords for grade L thru 4 are available by contacting your student's teacher if they do not have this information. Please contact your student's school if you do not know their student ID.
Step 3: Scroll down when in Clever. All single sign-on applications will automatically display in the "Single Sign-On" section and will not require additional login information. Other available links may require additional login information and would be available through your student's teacher if your student does not have this information available. Please utilize the online directory to email staff.

div.p: The Capital School District is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions), national origin, citizenship or ancestry, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, or gender identity, against victims of domestic violence, sexual offenses, or stalking, or upon any other categories protected by federal, state, or local law. Inquiries regarding nondiscrimination policies should be directed to the Title IX, District 504 and ADA Coordinators: Capital School District, 198 Commerce Way, Dover DE 19904. Phone 302-672-1500
